item.text: Section GG: Functional Abilities and Goals

Self-Care. Code the {patient's/resident's} usual performance at {admission} for each activity using the 6-point scale. If activity was not attempted at {admission}, code the reason. Code the {patient's/resident's} {discharge} goal(s) using the 6 point scale. Use of codes 07, 09, 10, or 88 is permissible to code {discharge} goal(s).
Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to the mouth and swallow food and/or liquid once the meal is placed before the {patient/resident}. - Admission Performance

Oral hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures into and from the mouth, and manage denture soaking and rinsing with use of equipment. - Admission Performance

Toileting hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal hygiene, adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening but not managing equipment. - Admission Performance

Mobility. Code the {patient's/resident's} usual performance at {admission} for each activity using the 6-point scale. If activity was not attempted at {admission}, code the reason. Code the {patient's/resident's} {discharge} goal(s) using the 6-point scale. Use of codes 07, 09, 10, or 88 is permissible to code {discharge} goal(s).
Roll left and right: The ability to roll from lying on back to left and right side, and return to lying on back on the bed. - Admission Performance
Sit to lying: The ability to move from sitting on side of bed to lying flat on the bed. - Admission Performance
Lying to sitting on side of bed: The ability to move from lying on the back to sitting on the side of the bed with feet flat on the floor, and with no back support. - Admission Performance
Sit to stand: The ability to come to a standing position from sitting in a chair, wheelchair, or on the side of the bed. - Admission Performance
Chair/bed-to-chair transfer: The ability to transfer to and from a bed to a chair (or wheelchair). - Admission Performance
Toilet transfer: The ability to get on and off a toilet or commode. - Admission Performance
Walk 10 feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 10 feet in a room, corridor, or similar space. - Admission Performance
Walk 50 feet with two turns: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Admission Performance
Walk 150 feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Admission Performance
